results.title: Beta-blocker brain concentrations in man.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@SAH@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who came to surgery were investigated if they had been receiving chronic (approximately one week) oral treatment with either hydrophilic @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (100 mg/day) or one of the following lipophilic beta-blockers: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (80 mg b.i.d.), @CHEMICAL_Oxprenolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010096 @@@oxprenolol@@@ (80 mg b.i.d.), or @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ (100 mg b.i.d.).

citations.NLM: Cruickshank JM, Neil-Dwyer G. Beta-blocker brain concentrations in man. Eur J Clin Pharmacol. 1985;28 Suppl():21-3. PMID: 2865144
citations.BibTeX: @article{2865144, title={Beta-blocker brain concentrations in man.}, author={Cruickshank JM and Neil-Dwyer G}, journal={Eur J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={28 Suppl}, pages={21-3}}

results.title: Provokable left ventricular outflow tract obstruction in a patient without hypertrophy.
results.text_hl: He had a family history of @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@ischemic heart disease@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Subarachnoid_Hemorrhage</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013345 @@@subarachnoid hemorrhage@@@.

citations.NLM: Pasquale F, Tomé-Esteban MT, Morgagni R, Elliott P. Provokable left ventricular outflow tract obstruction in a patient without hypertrophy. Nat Rev Cardiol. 2009 Apr;6(4):313-6. PMID: 19352335
